DataElement.preferredName: Her 2 Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Level Laboratory Procedure Outcome Range
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Result of Her-2 Testing for fluorescent-tagged amplification, expressed as a range of values.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Her 2 Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Level
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization.

ObjectClass.preferredName: ERBB2 Receptor Protein-Tyrosine Kinase Fluorescence in situ Hybridization
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: HER2/neu.  The HER2/neu protein is involved in growth of some cancer cells. Also called c-erbB-2.:A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.

Concepts.definition: HER2/neu.  The HER2/neu protein is involved in growth of some cancer cells. Also called c-erbB-2.

A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.

Property.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.  (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
